RT @TVNBR: Pres. @dilmabr speaks now, at the signing ceremony of the # PonteRioNiterói concession. Follow #AoVivo: http://t.co/p3mX3NcIFQ
We did the bidding and got a smaller toll than the one currently practiced. # RioNiterói
The bridge will have an operational improvement, adding to the structure new benefits. # RioNiterói
RT @blogplanalto: Dilma: We incorporated important issues into this venture for RJ and Niterói # PonteRioNiterói
We, from now on, will enter the second phase of the Concession Programs, which we will launch in June. # RioNiterói
This will be a somewhat broader program because it will encompass not only highways but ports, airports, railways and other concessions.
Going to the second concession stage shows that we have enough maturity to have projects respected, with rules complied with. # RioNiterói
There was no imbalance in the contract and that means robustness in a concession project. It is credible and strong. # RioNiterói
I wish lots of work and luck for the dealers and benefits for the mayors of both Niterói and Rio de Janeiro. # RioNiterói

RT @blogplanalto: #AoVivo Statement by the president @dilmabr on the occasion of the visit of the Chinese Prime Minister to Brazil: http://t.co/s7v0Cx...
To my satisfaction, I welcome the Prime Minister of China, Li Keqiang, accompanied by an expressive governmental and business delegation.
This meeting reaffirms the intensity of our relations and follows up on the high level contacts that our governments have made frequent.
We build, through the principles of equality and mutual trust, the bases for Global Strategic Partnership between #BrasilChina.
We had a very productive meeting, marked by frank dialogue and a willingness to move forward, strengthen and make more effective our partnership.
The 2015-2021 Plan of Joint Action, which I signed with the Prime Minister, inaugurates a higher stage in our relationship. #BrasilChina
It is expressed in the various governmental and business agreements signed today, especially in the areas of investment and commerce.
Brazil attaches great importance to the signing of the Agreement on Investment and Productive Capacity (...) #BrasilChina
(...) which gathers in the areas of electric power, mining, infrastructure and manufacturing, totaling + 53 billion dollars. #BrasilChina
RT @blogplanalto: Dilma: Our three countries - Brazil, Peru and China - begin together feasibility studies for this railway connection ...
RT @blogplanalto: Dilma: This is the Transcontinental Railroad that will cross our country in the east-west direction along the southern continent ...
RT @blogplanalto: Dilma: A new path to Asia will open to Brazil, reducing distances and costs. #BrasilChina
Our bilateral trade totaled almost 80 billion dollars in 2014. #BrasilChina http://t.co/tIjDDi1goF
China is Brazil's 1st trading partner and in order to intensify our exchange, we have adopted several important measures. #BrasilChina
New partnerships for trade and productive investment are being signed today. #BrasilChina
We are diversifying the range of Brazilian exports to China, increasing the share of products with higher added value.
The delivery of the first batch of 22 aircraft, among the 60 sold by Embraer to Tianjin Airlines, is an important milestone in this direction.
Bees. http://t.co/gzqCOf1l0i
All this vast exchange will be further boosted by the decisions we make today. #BrasilChina http://t.co/nCR7RwkUa0
I am grateful for the partnership in the program # CiênciaSemFronteiras, which today welcomes hundreds of students and researchers. #BrasilChina
RT @blogplanalto: Dilma: Our partnership also advances in the field of education, technology and innovation.
China and Brazil have played a leading role in building a new global order. #BrasilChina http://t.co/SpaGfdT545
This partnership is particularly important in 2015, when the United Nations celebrates its 70th anniversary. #BrasilChina
I reiterated that it will allow us to deepen our perspective in favor of reforming the UN Security Council. #BrasilChina
As a Chinese proverb says, "if the wind blows in a single direction, the tree will grow inclined." #BrasilChina http://t.co/NgHXYgsuvP
We must improve our economic relations, always seeking greater harmony, respect and mutual benefits. #BrasilChina
It is for this purpose that the three strategic commitments that we renew today must converge: the expansion of investments (..)
(...) an increasingly intense and diversified trade and the deepening of partnerships in education, science, technology and innovation #BrasilChina
I hope that your visit to Brazil will be followed by other opportunities for the people and government to reiterate their esteem and appreciation for China.
